meanings.definition: The plural form of denarius, an ancient Roman silver coin.
meanings.sent1: In the museum, you can see a collection of denarii from ancient Rome.
meanings.sent2: The merchant accepted denarii as payment for the goods.
meanings.sent3: The archaeologist found a hidden stash of denarii buried in the ruins.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like denarii in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The sound of denarii clinking together was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: During the festival, people would exchange denarii for goods and services.
meanings.sent2: The soldier received his salary in denarii for his service.
meanings.sent3: The baker accidentally gave out denarii instead of regular coins as change.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a bag of denarii.
meanings.sent5: The denarii jingled in his pocket as he walked through the marketplace.
